sponsor.partnerMessage: The market has never been hotter, and GTW Group is ready to help you achieve your real estate goals. GTW Group at EXP Realty has been serving NWA since 2018. Whether you’re listing your home or looking for your next—check out their website & contact them for a #GreatTeamWin.

posts.title: Planning Commission To Discuss Rezoning Of 112-Drive In Property
posts.content:
A request was submitted to the City of Fayetteville earlier this month to rezone the 112 Drive-In property in order to allow a wide variety of commercial and residential uses.

  • New spaces: The 112 Drive-In property is nearly 20-acres and is set to be sold to developers. A tentative site plan shows a variety of options for housing and commercial uses such as retail or restaurant spaces. 
  • A theatre to stay: The potential plans for the property currently include a smaller outdoor movie screen with an 805-seat cinema with a beer garden. The rezoning request will be discussed in the Planning Commission’s April 11 meeting.

Read the full Fayetteville Flyer story HERE.

posts.title: Sustainable Trails Conference Happening In Bentonville
posts.content:
The Sustainable Trails Conference in Bentonville is happening this week and though the core conference is sold out, there is still opportunity to register for a couple workshops. 

  • Trail systems: The conference is for organizations involved in trail planning and design, construction and maintenance, or fundraising. The aim of the conference is to improve NWA’s trails and the industry at large while providing access to the world’s highest quality trail professionals. 
  • Workshops: There are six tickets for the Stonework for Trails workshop and six tickets for the Crafting Rock Features with Machinery still available. 

Learn more and register for the workshops HERE.

posts.title: Pinball Makes A Resurgence In NWA
posts.content:
A game decades old is experiencing an international revival and Northwest Arkansas’s pinball bar is here for it. 

  • Multi-generational: Pinpoint is a bar in Fayetteville that now hosts monthly tournaments as part of the International Flipper Pinball Association (IFPA). The bar has almost 50 pinball games in its collection and has over 30 players attending tournaments on a regular basis. 
  • Go play: It costs a $1 IFPA fee to play in the tournaments that are held every second Sunday of the month, and newcomers are always welcome. If you aren’t comfortable in a tournament setting, Pinpoint also hosts one-night-play games on the last Tuesday of every month. 

Listen to the KUAF story HERE to learn more.

posts.title: Fox Trail & Modoko Partner To Serve Ticketed 4-Course Meal
posts.content:
Fox Trail Distillery and Modoko Asian Kitchen are collaborating to provide a four-course specialty dinner next week, and you’re invited. 

  • An event to remember: The courses will include Green Curry Ceviche, Lobster Wellington, Prime Rib, and a dessert. To go along with the courses, Fox Trail will expertly pair specialty bourbon cocktails with the meal made with its O’Highlands Bourbon and Wild Parallel Bourbon in Straight, Toasted and Islay finishes.
  • Save a spot: The evening will be held at Modoko Asian Kitchen in Rogers on April 7 at 6p. Tickets are $120 per person and may be purchased online. $20 is required to hold the ticket, and the rest will be paid at the event. Advanced registration is required.

Register HERE.

posts.title: Residence Community Plans For Grand Opening Next Week
posts.content:
New locations for living are slowly popping up around Northwest Arkansas. 

  • Cut the ribbon: A new 55+ community located at 750 S Promenade Blvd in Rogers is having its grand opening celebration next week on April 7 and attendees can expect snacks, property tours, networking, and more. 
  • Everything you could need: The new community is called Promenade Commons and will offer 131 units with nearby access to shopping, dining, entertainment, and medical offices. The Promenade Commons amenities include but are not limited to a heated pool, a dog park, and interior courtyards with putting greens. 

Learn more about Promenade Commons HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Set up for greatness: Looking for a job that truly fulfills you? Take the Highlands Ability Battery at Revision Coaching to find a career with purpose.*
  • Free trees: If you are a resident of Bella Vista don’t miss out on the spring tree giveaway, Thursday, April 14th! A tree or shrub is yours with proof of residency.
  • Save some dates: The Fayetteville Public Library has released its April event calendar, and it’s jam-packed with awesome events from yoga to a high school equivalency program taught completely in Spanish.
  • Viral: A local TikTok artist has created dozens of short videos showcasing everyday places in NWA, check out their lovely work!
  • Banking options: Missouri-based lender, Sterling Bank, recently officially opened its doors to Fayetteville.
  • Have something to tell? Check out our advertising deals here, and we'll help you tell it!

*Content is sponsored
